channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: White House justifies strikes on boat survivors, but it's unclear where buck stops
item.description: In the face of charges that these strikes amount to execution without trial, the White House is sending a confusing message about who exactly gave each order to use deadly force.
item.content:encoded:
In the face of charges that these strikes amount to execution without trial, the White House is sending a confusing message about who exactly gave each order to use deadly force.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: The Trump administration fires at least 7 immigration judges in New York
item.description: The Trump administration fired immigration judges in New York on Monday. NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Jeremiah Johnson Executive Vice President of the National Association of Immigration Judges.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration fired immigration judges in New York on Monday. NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Jeremiah Johnson Executive Vice President of the National Association of Immigration Judges.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Firms that help military vets with their disability claims can charge exorbitant fees
item.description: NPR has been following the money behind veterans' disability claims — specifically, for-profit companies that help vets navigate the VA's red tape. Critics of the companies call them "claim sharks."
item.content:encoded: NPR has been following the money behind veterans' disability claims — specifically, for-profit companies that help vets navigate the VA's red tape. Critics of the companies call them "claim sharks."
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Michael and Susan Dell commit $6.25 billion for investment accounts for kids
item.description: Michael and Susan Dell are donating $6.25 billion to fund "Trump Accounts" for 25 million U.S. children. The gift would put $250 into each eligible child's account.
item.content:encoded:
Michael and Susan Dell are donating $6.25 billion to fund "Trump Accounts" for 25 million U.S. children. The gift would put $250 into each eligible child's account.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin II)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: A major winter storm is pummeling the Northeast with ice and snow
item.description: A system expected to drop 6 inches of snow or more from Pennsylvania to Maine could tie up the Tuesday evening commute, the National Weather Service says.
item.content:encoded:
A system expected to drop 6 inches of snow or more from Pennsylvania to Maine could tie up the Tuesday evening commute, the National Weather Service says.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'Franklin' publisher slams Hegseth for his post of the turtle firing on drug boats
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faces growing scrutiny over an attack on an alleged drug boat. His response included a parody of the kids' book character Franklin, showing the turtle firing at boats.
item.content:encoded:
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faces growing scrutiny over an attack on an alleged drug boat. His response included a parody of the kids' book character Franklin, showing the turtle firing at boats.
















(Image credit: Felix Leon)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: This company charges disabled vets millions, even after VA said it's likely illegal
item.description: A Florida-based company is charging military veterans as much as $20,000 for help with disability claims, even though the VA has said that may be illegal and the service should be free. But so far nobody's stopping the company and others like it.
item.content:encoded:
A Florida-based company is charging military veterans as much as $20,000 for help with disability claims, even though the VA has said that may be illegal and the service should be free. But so far nobody's stopping the company and others like it.

(Image credit: Via Dustin)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: Suspect in National Guard shooting makes first court appearance
item.description: On Tuesday, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, 29, was formally charged in D.C. Superior Court with multiple crimes, including first-degree murder and assault with the intent to kill while armed.
item.content:encoded:
On Tuesday, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, 29, was formally charged in D.C. Superior Court with multiple crimes, including first-degree murder and assault with the intent to kill while armed.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Republican Matt Van Epps narrowly wins special House election in Tennessee
item.description: Republican Matt Van Epps has won the special election for Tennessee's 7th Congressional District, but Aftyn Behn's overperformance has Democrats declaring a victory of sorts, too.
item.content:encoded:
Republican Matt Van Epps has won the special election for Tennessee's 7th Congressional District, but Aftyn Behn's overperformance has Democrats declaring a victory of sorts, too.

(Image credit: Brett Carlsen)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Lawmakers concerned Venezuela boat strike could constitute war crime, U.S. envoy back in Moscow as peace talks continue, Afghan suspect in National Guard attack appeared to suffer personal crisis.
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers concerned Venezuela boat strike could constitute war crime, U.S. envoy back in Moscow as peace talks continue, Afghan suspect in National Guard attack appeared to suffer personal crisis.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez
